str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To shake up, stir up, excite. From ana and seio; figuratively, to excite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.
Barabbas. Of Chaldee origin; son of Abba; Bar-abbas, an Israelite.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
